page.title: 09PAINSWICK HOUSE(continued)
page.content: has exotic birds in pink and green on it. There is also a portable chapel which is Venetian, and looks like an organ with no keys, but when it is unfolded it turns into an altar. The green dining room consists of an enormous table with twenty two places. The table can be split up and spread round the room if necessary. In the room there are lots of paintings such as Grandmaster Pinto, and Sir Francis Hyett. Upstairs on the landing there is a bust of Queen Victoria and a stained glass window decorated with coats of arms, and the words "Cor Immoble" which means "Steadfast Heart." In the upstairs bedroom is a fourposter bed with a special lock on the door. Many important people have visited Painswick House: Brunel, Benjamin Disraeli, General Eisenhower,who was
